thing-type.label: MH-S512 Touch Panel Switch 2-Way
thing-type.description: Touch Panel Switch 2-Way<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtTouch Panel Switch is a wall panel built-in with Z-Wave Plus module. With its stylish design and stable performance, the panel can be used to control house-hold electrical appliances like lamp, motor, coffee machine, TV set etc. It supports basic command class, multi channel command class and multi channel association command class, also works as a repeater in a Z-Wave network.</p&gt<p&gtThis product can be included and operated in any Z-Wave network with other Z-Wave certified devices from any other manufacturers.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtADD the device into Z-Wave network:</p&gt <ol&gt<li&gtSet controller into ADD mode. Follow instructions provided by controller manufacturer.</li&gt <li&gtPress and hold any key on the panel for 8 seconds or 3 clicks in quick succession.</li&gt </ol&gt<p&gtNote: If the ADD is successful, all INDICATION LEDs on the panel will flash 4 times.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtREMOVE the device from Z-Wave network:</p&gt <ol&gt<li&gtSet controller into REMOVE mode. Follow instructions provided by controller manufacturer.</li&gt <li&gtPress and hold any key on the panel for 8 seconds or 3 clicks in quick succession.</li&gt </ol&gt<p&gtNote: If the REMOVE is successful, all INDICATION LEDs on the panel will flash 4 times. The REMOVE will delete all association data.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtWakeup Information</h2&gt<p&gt<br /&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_2_1
parameter.label: 2: Save switch state on power failure
parameter.description: Save switch state on power failure<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt0: Switch state not saved, switch will be off when power is restored.<br /&gt1: Switch state is saved, switch will be back to the same state when power is restored.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_3_1
parameter.label: 3: ALL ON / ALL OFF
parameter.description: Allow all on/off control<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt0: forbid ALL ON, forbid ALL OFF<br /&gt1: forbid ALL ON, allow ALL OFF<br /&gt2: allow ALL ON, forbid ALL OFF<br /&gt255: allow ALL ON, allow ALL OFF</p&gt</p&gt

options.option: Forbid All ON. Allow ALL OFF
Allow ALL ON. Forbid ALL OFF
Allow ALL ON. Allow ALL OFF

parameter.name: config_4_1
parameter.label: 4: LED backlight brightness level
parameter.description: LED backlight brightness level<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt0: LED lighting disabled<br /&gt1 ~ 10: Minimum to Maximum brightness<br /&gt11 ~ 255: Same as 10 (Maximum)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_5_1
parameter.label: 5: Switch 0 Key Mode
parameter.description: Switch 0 Key Mode<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt0: single click to switch on/off status<br /&gt1: Key default as off state. When it is turned on, then it will be turned off automatically after a time period, which can be set in Parameter 6<br /&gt2: Key default as on state. When it is turned off, then it will be turned on automatically after a time period, which can be set in Parameter 6<br /&gt3: hold &gt;3s then key is on, and off once released<br /&gt4: single click to switch on/off status + hold &gt;3s then key is on, and off once released<br /&gt5: Hold continuously then key is on, and off once released<br /&gt6: When key is on, hold &gt;3s then key is off and will keep off status after released; When key is off, hold &gt;3s then key is on and will stay on status after released.</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gtIMPORTANT NOTE: </strong&gtWhen key mode is 0x03 or 0x04, pressing for 8 seconds will NOT ADD/REMOVE from the network. You must use 3 clicks in quick succession, or change to another option if possible before removing.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_6_2
parameter.label: 6: Key timer duration
parameter.description: Key timer duration<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt0: infinite (always on, or always off, when pressed)<br /&gt1 ~ 65535: time in seconds until returning to the default state as per Parameter 5</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_7_1
parameter.label: 7: External Switch Type
parameter.description: External Switch Type<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt0: Button (Momentary buttons)<br /&gt1: Toggle (2-state switches)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_8_1
parameter.label: 8: Basic CC integration setting
parameter.description: Basic CC integration setting<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt0: "Basic Set" received, key 1 responds; "Basic Get" received, key 1 sends "Basic Report"; key 1 will not send unsolicited "Basic Report"（No Endpoint）to LifeLine Association<br /&gt1: "Basic Set" received, key 1 responds; "Basic Get" received，key 1 sends "Basic Report"; key 1 will send unsolicited "Basic Report"（No Endpoint）to LifeLine Association<br /&gt2: "Basic Set" received, all keys respond; "Basic Get" received, not reply "Basic Report"; All keys will not send unsolicited "Basic Report"（No Endpoint）to LifeLine Association<br /&gt3: "Basic Set" received, all keys respond; "Basic Get" received, key 1 sends "Basic Report"; All keys will not send unsolicited "Basic Report"（No Endpoint）to LifeLine Association</p&gt <p&gtThis parameter works for integration with different gateways/systems. If do not know how to use, please keep as default.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_9_1
parameter.label: 9: External switch to control specific load
parameter.description: External switch to control specific load<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt0: Disabled<br /&gt1: Load 1<br /&gt2: Load 2<br /&gt3: Load 1 and Load 2</p&gt <p&gtOptional for MH-S511 and MH-S512</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_10_1
parameter.label: 10: Switch 1 Key Mode
parameter.description: Switch 1 Key Mode<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt0: single click to switch on/off status<br /&gt1: Key default as off state. When it is turned on, then it will be turned off automatically after a time period, which can be set in Parameter 6<br /&gt2: Key default as on state. When it is turned off, then it will be turned on automatically after a time period, which can be set in Parameter 6<br /&gt3: hold &gt;3s then key is on, and off once released<br /&gt4: single click to switch on/off status + hold &gt;3s then key is on, and off once released<br /&gt5: Hold continuously then key is on, and off once released<br /&gt6: When key is on, hold &gt;3s then key is off and will keep off status after released; When key is off, hold &gt;3s then key is on and will stay on status after released.</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gtIMPORTANT NOTE: </strong&gtWhen key mode is 0x03 or 0x04, pressing for 8 seconds will NOT ADD/REMOVE from the network. You must use 3 clicks in quick succession, or change to another option if possible before removing.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_11_1
parameter.label: 11: Switch 2 Key Mode
parameter.description: Switch 2 Key Mode<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt0: single click to switch on/off status<br /&gt1: Key default as off state. When it is turned on, then it will be turned off automatically after a time period, which can be set in Parameter 6<br /&gt2: Key default as on state. When it is turned off, then it will be turned on automatically after a time period, which can be set in Parameter 6<br /&gt3: hold &gt;3s then key is on, and off once released<br /&gt4: single click to switch on/off status + hold &gt;3s then key is on, and off once released<br /&gt5: Hold continuously then key is on, and off once released<br /&gt6: When key is on, hold &gt;3s then key is off and will keep off status after released; When key is off, hold &gt;3s then key is on and will stay on status after released.</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gtIMPORTANT NOTE: </strong&gtWhen key mode is 0x03 or 0x04, pressing for 8 seconds will NOT ADD/REMOVE from the network. You must use 3 clicks in quick succession, or change to another option if possible before removing.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_12_1
parameter.label: 12: Switch 3 Key Mode
parameter.description: Switch 3 Key Mode<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt<strong&gtINACTIVE:</strong&gt This is included in the firmware but only functions on the MH-S513 which has three buttons</p&gt <p&gt0: single click to switch on/off status<br /&gt1: Key default as off state. When it is turned on, then it will be turned off automatically after a time period, which can be set in Parameter 6<br /&gt2: Key default as on state. When it is turned off, then it will be turned on automatically after a time period, which can be set in Parameter 6<br /&gt3: hold &gt;3s then key is on, and off once released<br /&gt4: single click to switch on/off status + hold &gt;3s then key is on, and off once released<br /&gt5: Hold continuously then key is on, and off once released<br /&gt6: When key is on, hold &gt;3s then key is off and will keep off status after released; When key is off, hold &gt;3s then key is on and will on status after released.</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gtIMPORTANT NOTE: </strong&gtWhen key mode is 0x03 or 0x04, pressing for 8 seconds will NOT ADD/REMOVE from the network. You must use 3 clicks in quick succession, or change to another option if possible before removing.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_14_1
parameter.label: 14: Key lock local
parameter.description: Key lock function (Manually)<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis prevents or allows the local touch buttons to work.</p&gt <p&gt0: All keys unlocked<br /&gt1: Key 1 locked<br /&gt2: Key 2 locked<br /&gt3: Keys 1 &amp; 2 locked<br /&gt4: Key 3 locked - N/A<br /&gt5: Keys 1 &amp; 3 locked - N/A<br /&gt6: Keys 2 &amp; 3 locked - N/A<br /&gt7: Keys 1 &amp; 2 &amp; 3 locked - N/A</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gtBinary bit locations determine which keys are locked.</strong&gt<br /&gtBIT0: =1 Key 1 locked, operation disabled; =0 Key 1 not locked;<br /&gtBIT1: =1 Key 2 locked, operation disabled; =0 Key 2 not locked;<br /&gtBIT2: =1 Key 3 locked, operation disabled; =0 Key 3 not locked;<br /&gtBIT7: Reserved</p&gt <p&gtE.g. 0x05 (00000101) From right to left Bit 0 and 2 are on so Key 1 and 3 are locked.</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gtNOTE:</strong&gt Key 3 only on MH-S513.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_15_1
parameter.label: 15: Key lock remote
parameter.description: Key lock function (Wirelessly)<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis prevents or allows the local touch buttons to work.</p&gt <p&gt0: All keys unlocked<br /&gt1: Key 1 locked<br /&gt2: Key 2 locked<br /&gt3: Keys 1 &amp; 2 locked<br /&gt4: Key 3 locked - N/A<br /&gt5: Keys 1 &amp; 3 locked - N/A<br /&gt6: Keys 2 &amp; 3 locked - N/A<br /&gt7: Keys 1 &amp; 2 &amp; 3 locked - N/A</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gtBinary bit locations determine which keys are locked.</strong&gt<br /&gtBIT0: =1 Key 1 locked, operation disabled; =0 Key 1 not locked;<br /&gtBIT1: =1 Key 2 locked, operation disabled; =0 Key 2 not locked;<br /&gtBIT2: =1 Key 3 locked, operation disabled; =0 Key 3 not locked;<br /&gtBIT7: Reserved</p&gt <p&gtE.g. 0x05 (00000101) From right to left Bit 0 and 2 are on so Key 1 and 3 are locked.</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gtNOTE:</strong&gt Key 3 only on MH-S513.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_16_1
parameter.label: 16: Scene respond
parameter.description: Scene respond<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt0: Scene respond disabled<br /&gt1: Key 1 respond<br /&gt2: Key 2 respond<br /&gt3: Keys 1 &amp; 2 respond<br /&gt4: Key 3 respond - N/A<br /&gt5: Keys 1 &amp; 3 respond - N/A<br /&gt6: Keys 2 &amp; 3 respond - N/A<br /&gt7: Keys 1 &amp; 2 &amp; 3 respond - N/A</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gtBinary bit locations determine which keys will respond.</strong&gt<br /&gtBit0: =1 Key1 respond scene =0 Key1 not respond scene<br /&gtBit1: =1 Key2 respond scene =0 Key2 not respond scene<br /&gtBit2: =1 Key3 respond scene =0 Key3 not respond scene<br /&gtBit7: Reserved</p&gt <p&gtE.g. 0x05 (00000101) From right to left Bit 0 and 2 are on so Key 1 and 3 will respond.</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gtNOTE:</strong&gt Key 3 only on MH-S513.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_17_1
parameter.label: 17: Key 1 Scene Mode
parameter.description: Key 1 Scene Activate Mode Setting<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt0: Scene activate function disabled<br /&gt1: One click key1, always activate scene ID1 no matter what the status of key1 is<br /&gt2: One click key1, only activate scene ID1 when key1's relay output is open<br /&gt3: One click key1, only activate scene ID1 when key1's relay output is closed</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_18_1
parameter.label: 18: Key 1 Activate Scene ID
parameter.description: Key 1 Activate Scene ID<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt0: Scene ID is invalid and will not send scene activate command (scene disabled)<br /&gt1 ~ 255: Scene ID</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_19_1
parameter.label: 19: Key 1 Activate Scene Duration
parameter.description: Key 1 Activate Scene Duration<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt0: Instantly<br /&gt1 ~ 127: Specify dimming duration from 1 second (0x01) to 127 seconds (0x7F) in 1-second resolution<br /&gt128 ~ 254: Specify dimming duration from 1 minute (0x80(128)) to 127 minutes (0xFE(254)) in 1-minute resolution</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_20_1
parameter.label: 20: Key 2 Scene Mode
parameter.description: Key 2 Scene Mode<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt0: Scene activate function disabled<br /&gt1: One click key2, always activate scene ID1 no matter what the status of key2 is<br /&gt2: One click key2, only activate scene ID1 when key2's relay output is open<br /&gt3: One click key2, only activate scene ID1 when key2's relay output is closed</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_21_1
parameter.label: 21: Key 2 Activate Scene ID
parameter.description: Key 2 Activate Scene ID<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt0: Scene ID is invalid and will not send scene activate command (scene disabled)<br /&gt1 ~ 255: Scene ID</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_22_1
parameter.label: 22: Key 2 Activate Scene Duration
parameter.description: Key 2 Activate Scene Duration<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt0: Instantly<br /&gt1 ~ 127: Specify dimming duration from 1 second (0x01) to 127 seconds (0x7F) in 1-second resolution<br /&gt128 ~ 254: Specify dimming duration from 1 minute (0x80(128)) to 127 minutes (0xFE(254)) in 1-minute resolution</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_23_1
parameter.label: 23: Key 3 Scene Mode
parameter.description: Key 3 Scene Mode<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt<strong&gtINACTIVE:</strong&gt This is included in the firmware but only functions on the MH-S513 which has three buttons</p&gt <p&gt0: Scene activate function disabled<br /&gt1: One click key3, always activate scene ID1 no matter what the status of key3 is<br /&gt2: One click key3, only activate scene ID1 when key3's relay output is open<br /&gt3: One click key3, only activate scene ID1 when key3's relay output is closed</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_24_1
parameter.label: 24: Key 3 Activate Scene ID
parameter.description: Key 3 Activate Scene ID<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt<strong&gtINACTIVE:</strong&gt This is included in the firmware but only functions on the MH-S513 which has three buttons</p&gt <p&gt0: Scene ID is invalid and will not send scene activate command (scene disabled)<br /&gt1 ~ 255: Scene ID</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_25_1
parameter.label: 25: Key 3 Activate Scene Duration
parameter.description: Key 3 Activate Scene Duration<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt<strong&gtINACTIVE:</strong&gt This is included in the firmware but only functions on the MH-S513 which has three buttons</p&gt <p&gt0: Instantly<br /&gt1 ~ 127: Specify dimming duration from 1 second (0x01) to 127 seconds (0x7F) in 1-second resolution<br /&gt128 ~ 254: Specify dimming duration from 1 minute (0x80(128)) to 127 minutes (0xFE(254)) in 1-minute resolution</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_31_1
parameter.label: 31: Central scene settings
parameter.description: Central scene settings<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis enables the central scene function for each button.</p&gt <p&gt0: All keys disabled<br /&gt1: Key 1 enabled<br /&gt2: Key 2 enabled<br /&gt3: Keys 1 &amp; 2 enabled<br /&gt4: Key 3 enabled - N/A<br /&gt5: Keys 1 &amp; 3 enabled - N/A<br /&gt6: Keys 2 &amp; 3 enabled - N/A<br /&gt7: Keys 1 &amp; 2 &amp; 3 enabled - N/A</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gtBinary bit locations determine which keys are enabled.</strong&gt<br /&gtBIT0: =1 Key 1 disabled; =0 Key 1 enabled;<br /&gtBIT1: =1 Key 2 disabled; =0 Key 2 enabled;<br /&gtBIT2: =1 Key 3 disabled; =0 Key 3 enabled;<br /&gtBIT7: Reserved</p&gt <p&gtE.g. 0x05 (00000101) From right to left Bit 0 and 2 are on so Key 1 and 3 are enabled.</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gtNOTE:</strong&gt Key 3 only on MH-S513.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_32_1
parameter.label: 32: Scene respond ID 1-50
parameter.description: Scene respond ID 1-50<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis enables the scene function for each button. Scene ID 1 - 50</p&gt <p&gt0: All keys disabled<br /&gt1: Key 1 enabled<br /&gt2: Key 2 enabled<br /&gt3: Keys 1 &amp; 2 enabled<br /&gt4: Key 3 enabled - N/A<br /&gt5: Keys 1 &amp; 3 enabled - N/A<br /&gt6: Keys 2 &amp; 3 enabled - N/A<br /&gt7: Keys 1 &amp; 2 &amp; 3 enabled - N/A</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gtBinary bit locations determine which keys are enabled.</strong&gt<br /&gtBIT0: =1 Key 1 disabled; =0 Key 1 enabled;<br /&gtBIT1: =1 Key 2 disabled; =0 Key 2 enabled;<br /&gtBIT2: =1 Key 3 disabled; =0 Key 3 enabled;<br /&gtBIT7: Reserved</p&gt <p&gtE.g. 0x05 (00000101) From right to left Bit 0 and 2 are on so Key 1 and 3 are enabled.</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gtNOTE:</strong&gt Key 3 only on MH-S513.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_33_1
parameter.label: 33: Scene respond ID 51-100
parameter.description: Scene respond ID 51-100<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis enables the scene function for each button. Scene ID 51 - 100</p&gt <p&gt0: All keys disabled<br /&gt1: Key 1 enabled<br /&gt2: Key 2 enabled<br /&gt3: Keys 1 &amp; 2 enabled<br /&gt4: Key 3 enabled - N/A<br /&gt5: Keys 1 &amp; 3 enabled - N/A<br /&gt6: Keys 2 &amp; 3 enabled - N/A<br /&gt7: Keys 1 &amp; 2 &amp; 3 enabled - N/A</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gtBinary bit locations determine which keys are enabled.</strong&gt<br /&gtBIT0: =1 Key 1 disabled; =0 Key 1 enabled;<br /&gtBIT1: =1 Key 2 disabled; =0 Key 2 enabled;<br /&gtBIT2: =1 Key 3 disabled; =0 Key 3 enabled;<br /&gtBIT7: Reserved</p&gt <p&gtE.g. 0x05 (00000101) From right to left Bit 0 and 2 are on so Key 1 and 3 are enabled.</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gtNOTE:</strong&gt Key 3 only on MH-S513.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_34_1
parameter.label: 34: Scene respond ID 101-150
parameter.description: Scene respond ID 101-150<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis enables the scene function for each button. Scene ID 51 - 100</p&gt <p&gt0: All keys disabled<br /&gt1: Key 1 enabled<br /&gt2: Key 2 enabled<br /&gt3: Keys 1 &amp; 2 enabled<br /&gt4: Key 3 enabled - N/A<br /&gt5: Keys 1 &amp; 3 enabled - N/A<br /&gt6: Keys 2 &amp; 3 enabled - N/A<br /&gt7: Keys 1 &amp; 2 &amp; 3 enabled - N/A</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gtBinary bit locations determine which keys are enabled.</strong&gt<br /&gtBIT0: =1 Key 1 disabled; =0 Key 1 enabled;<br /&gtBIT1: =1 Key 2 disabled; =0 Key 2 enabled;<br /&gtBIT2: =1 Key 3 disabled; =0 Key 3 enabled;<br /&gtBIT7: Reserved</p&gt <p&gtE.g. 0x05 (00000101) From right to left Bit 0 and 2 are on so Key 1 and 3 are enabled.</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gtNOTE:</strong&gt Key 3 only on MH-S513.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_35_1
parameter.label: 35: Scene respond ID 151-200
parameter.description: Scene respond ID 151-200<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis enables the scene function for each button. Scene ID 151 - 200</p&gt <p&gt0: All keys disabled<br /&gt1: Key 1 enabled<br /&gt2: Key 2 enabled<br /&gt3: Keys 1 &amp; 2 enabled<br /&gt4: Key 3 enabled - N/A<br /&gt5: Keys 1 &amp; 3 enabled - N/A<br /&gt6: Keys 2 &amp; 3 enabled - N/A<br /&gt7: Keys 1 &amp; 2 &amp; 3 enabled - N/A</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gtBinary bit locations determine which keys are enabled.</strong&gt<br /&gtBIT0: =1 Key 1 disabled; =0 Key 1 enabled;<br /&gtBIT1: =1 Key 2 disabled; =0 Key 2 enabled;<br /&gtBIT2: =1 Key 3 disabled; =0 Key 3 enabled;<br /&gtBIT7: Reserved</p&gt <p&gtE.g. 0x05 (00000101) From right to left Bit 0 and 2 are on so Key 1 and 3 are enabled.</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gtNOTE:</strong&gt Key 3 only on MH-S513.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_36_1_wo
parameter.label: 36: Scene respond ID 201-250
parameter.description: Scene respond ID 201-250<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis enables the scene function for each button. Scene ID 201 - 250</p&gt <p&gt0: All keys disabled<br /&gt1: Key 1 enabled<br /&gt2: Key 2 enabled<br /&gt3: Keys 1 &amp; 2 enabled<br /&gt4: Key 3 enabled - N/A<br /&gt5: Keys 1 &amp; 3 enabled - N/A<br /&gt6: Keys 2 &amp; 3 enabled - N/A<br /&gt7: Keys 1 &amp; 2 &amp; 3 enabled - N/A</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gtBinary bit locations determine which keys are enabled.</strong&gt<br /&gtBIT0: =1 Key 1 disabled; =0 Key 1 enabled;<br /&gtBIT1: =1 Key 2 disabled; =0 Key 2 enabled;<br /&gtBIT2: =1 Key 3 disabled; =0 Key 3 enabled;<br /&gtBIT7: Reserved</p&gt <p&gtE.g. 0x05 (00000101) From right to left Bit 0 and 2 are on so Key 1 and 3 are enabled.</p&gt <p&gt<strong&gtNOTE:</strong&gt Key 3 only on MH-S513.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_255_1_wo
parameter.label: 255: Factory Setting
parameter.description: restore factory defaults<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt<strong&gtFactory Reset.</strong&gt</p&gt <p&gt255: Factory reset switch.</p&gt</p&gt
